boardgame.description: XiangQi is one of the most played board games in the world. Translated loosely as _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;elephant game_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;, the name of XiangQi may have first been recorded in Songs of Chu during the 4th century BC of early China; in the state of Qi during the Warring State Period, the name _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;XiangQi_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; meant ivory Liubo pieces, not modern XiangQi played by Chinese. The modern Xiangqi set dates back to the Tang dynasty._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Based closely on ancient Chinese military strategy, XiangQi draws comparisons to European Chess, and indeed, both are descended from the ancient Indian game of Chaturanga._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;---_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;XiangQi, commonly referred to in English as _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Chinese Chess_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;, is played with 32 pieces (16 per player) on a board that is 9 lines wide and 10 lines long. As in the game of Go, the game is played on the intersections of the game board. The area of play is divided into two territories by a river in the middle of game board. In each territory there is a 3 line by 3 line palace, in which each player's respective General/Marshal is located. The object of the game is to capture the opponents's General/Marshal._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The pieces on both sides and their movements _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; special rules are:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 1 General: 1 Point orthogonally within the palace only. Not allowed to _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;lsquo;see_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo; the enemy General on an open file._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 2 Advisors: 1 point diagonally within the palace only._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 2 Chariots: Any distance orthogonally._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 2 Cannons: Moves like a Chariot. To capture, it must first leap over an intervening piece of either color._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 2 Horses: 1 point orthogonally, then one point diagonally._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 2 Elephants / Ministers: 2 points diagonally. Cannot cross the river._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 5 Soldiers: 1 point straight forward. Once across the river, can also move 1 point sideways instead._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Pieces capture as they move and never jump. The only exception (for both rules) apply to the cannon._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;---_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The price of the game varies depending on the material used in the game. Inexpensive sets are usually made with plastic or low-grade wooden pieces and a paper gameboard. Expensive sets are usually made with jade or high-grade wooden pieces and a wooden gameboard._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Variants_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Banqi - Game using same pieces_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Giog - Game using same pieces_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Mini Xiang Qi - Smaller version_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; San Guo Qi - Three-player version_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Qi Guo Xiang Qi - Seven-player version_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Changgi - Korean version_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

listing.notes: Wooden pieces with a thin paper board in a nicely decorated 4_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; by 4_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; box.
